entry.content:
A LinkPreviewMediator's consumer is a weak reference to a viewController

which may have been dismissed and deallocated before the

LinkPreviewMediator stops observing the WebState (which occurs when the

LinkPreviewMediator instance is deallocated).

entry.title: Check subresource filter through the new GMSCore Safe Browsing API
entry.content:
The SUBRESOURCE_FILTER threat type is replaced with

ABUSIVE_EXPERIENCE_VIOLATION and BETTER_ADS_VIOLATION in

http://cl/585940542. Update SafeBrowsingJavaThreatType to reflect

this change. Note that the old

SafeBrowsingJavaThreatType::SUBRESOURCE_FILTER was never sent to or

from the new API.



Also start to consume the threat attribute from the API to set the

subresource_filter_match field in ThreatMetadata. This is required

to support subresource filter checks through the new API.



Add a feature flag SafeBrowsingNewGmsApiForSubresourceFilterCheck to

control this feature. The flag is disabled by default.



Bug: 1496508

Change-Id: I08fbcf31d3bbc8abc912553884319854969a4122

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/test: Fix H.264 Coded Size Issue.
entry.content:
Previously the H.264 decoder was setup to only use the frames coded size

when decoding a frame. This results in md5 mismatches and artifacts in

cases where the size is cropped.



Updates the h264_dpb to have a coded size parameter for each picture

which represents the visible rect size. This value is fed instead of the

OUTPUT_queue_->Resolution() parameter when converting to YUV.



Test: Tested by running stateless_decoder on baseline and main h.264 test

suites. Additionally tested on Platform Interop h264_180_v4l2sf_to_v4l2sl.



Bug: b:315150783



Change-Id: I919ac110843f7bb7728bd4dd7b30d024f5f03c0c

entry.title: bounds_tracker: Removing incorrect CHECK
entry.content:
`OnWindowDestroying` will be triggered when destroying the observing

windows. But not all the observing windows have remap/restore bounds

inside the `bounds_database_`. Removing the incorrect `CHECK` that

checks the observing window always has bounds inside the bounds

database.



Fixed: b/315324089

entry.title: Insecure Form Warnings: Add testing capability to the util for iOS
entry.content:
Presently, IsInsecureFormAction is called to check if a form's action

URL is insecure for the purposes of the mixed form warnings. The form's

source URL is checked separately.



This doesn't work on iOS where we can't serve a good HTTPS response, or

a URL using a hostname other than 127.0.0.1.



This CL adds a testing method (SetInsecureFormPortsForTesting) to set

two port numbers:

- URLs with port=`port_treated_as_secure` are treated as secure in the

mixed form warning checks.

- URLs with port=`port_treated_as_insecure` are treated as insecure in

the mixed form warning checks.



This allows us to use http://127.0.0.1:port style URLs in iOS egtests.

entry.title: Make OOPPD JobPrint feature parameter default enabled
entry.content:
The out-of-process print drivers feature uses parameters to control

some aspects of the feature. Use of out-of-process for submitting a

job to print is differentiated from queries by use of a JobPrint

parameter.



Update the JobPrint parameter to be enabled by default. Note that this

is only relevant when the main feature is enabled.



Replace a remaining instance of directly referencing the feature

parameter with the helper method for checking against the feature and

the corresponding enterprise policy.



Correct PDFExtensionPrintingTest test setup to setup a fake printer.

Since these tests automatically perform printing, such behavior only

makes sense if there is a printer to submit to. The checks within the

OOPPD logic exposed this existing issue.

entry.title: [A11y] Freeze cache before hit testing
entry.content:
This change moves some popup hit testing logic from

RenderAccessibilityImpl to WebAXObject so that the hit testing can

freeze the AXObjectCache. Otherwise, we will hit test while processing

deferred accessibility events, which we want to avoid.



This fixes the linked crash, and better yet, the added test will hit

the crash every time without the fix and will not hit it at all with

the fix.



In order to move to WebAXObject, a getter was added on

ChromeClientImpl to retrieve the popup's document. This is very similar

to other popup methods that already exist on ChromeClientImpl.

entry.title: Fenced frame: Fix activeElement and hasFocus().
entry.content:
Currently, when a fenced frame has focus, its embedder's

`document.activeElement` will just return the body rather than the

fenced frame. Similarly, `document.hasFocus()` will return false when a

child fenced frame has focus, whereas it will return true if a child

iframe has focus. There's no security reason to not have fenced frames

behave like iframes in this case (the renderer has this information

anyway, nothing is leaked across a fenced frame boundary, and focus is

already gated to prevent cross-channel communication).



This CL modifies `FrameTree::Parent` to be able to traverse to the

parent of an HTMLFencedFrameElement. It does this by getting the

HTMLFencedFrameElement's owner's document's frame instead of the frame's

parent, which is null for a HTMLFencedFrameElement's frame. This change

will not affect anything inside of a fenced frame tree, since a fenced

frame root doesn't have access to its embedder's document.



As a result, when `FocusController::FocusedFrameOwnerElement` traverses

up a frame tree, it will be able to get the parent of an

HTMLFencedFrameElement when it's the focused element, and will be able

to properly check that `current_frame' is one of its ancestors.



We could previously make the assumption that if a frame tree doesn't

have focus, none of its children have focus. That assumption is broken

with MPArch. To fix that, this CL refactors

`FocusController::IsDocumentFocused` to account for the fact that an

HTMLFencedFrameElement can have focus while its embedder's frame tree

loses focus.



Change-Id: Ic7a1823113e2d9c4a22bff2b7b7b7df85c089d60

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4892841

Session storage data is only exposed to untrusted contexts when the

access level allows for it. Thus, storage.session.onChanged should

only listen for changes when the access level allows untrusted

contexts.



Fixed: 1342046

Change-Id: I9558108ed8dbfa8246ea2ad37e9b6657732e13b0

Reviewed-by: Devlin Cronin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1235161}

entry.title: Fix caret paint invalidation when moving to new blocks
entry.content:
When caret is moved between blocks, |previous_layout_block_| is used

to keep track of the old block for invalidation. However, there are

cases where |previous_layout_block_| is display-locked resulting in us failing to clear |previous_layout_block_| during paint invalidation.



The problem happens in the following sequence:



The caret is painted in block1

The caret is moved to block2. At the same time, block1 is moved out of view and is display locked.

During paint invalidation, block1 is skipped because it's display locked.

layout_block_=block2, previous_layout_block_=block1

The caret is moved to block3.

Because previous_layout_block_ is still block1, thus block2 is not invalidated.



Fix is to ensure previous_layout_block_ is invalidated and cleared during paint invalidation regardless of display lock.



Bug: 1475322

Change-Id: I79791d32c8eaa2915a799ef9174ad089d291b11f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5084864

Commit-Queue: Siye Liu

Reviewed-by: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1235160}

entry.title: Simplify OpenXr input generation
entry.content:
This simplifies the route that OpenXr takes to create it's input sources

in three main ways:



1) Improved plumbing of `hand_input_enabled` logic.

Rather than plumbing a bool down from `GetInputState, since the feature

is enabled on the session, the state of the feature is now assigned to

the `OpenXrInputHelper` and any necessary children at creation or

initialization depending on the pattern used by the class. This allows

for better reasoning about lazy-initialized objects in the class.

This also allows the OpenXrInputHelper to just always query for hand

data and allow the Controller to simply return null if the feature is

not enabled.



2) Create an "Update" method for OpenXrController

While the OpenXrInputHelper still drives the `xrSyncActions` call since

that call needs to be fed the data from both controllers, the

controllers themselves now also have a chance to update any data that

they may want to update. This is currently just setting the interaction

profile at an earlier time and updating hand data if it's enabled. This

does require splitting the `GetHandTrackingData` method into an `Update`

and an actual `build/query` step, but it allows us to store the struct

as a member and thus can prevent allocation/deallocation on a per-frame

basis, and better sets us up to allow future extensions for hand

tracking.



3) Move Gamepad building into the OpenXrController class

The logic currently only looks at the interaction profiles to determine

the type of gamepad that should be built; but the currently proposed

infrastructure for hand extensions would not add them to that map,

leaving them to always be `kNone`. While this very well may be the case,

the methods in question *also* pass around a Controller object to query

from, so it's also cleaner from that standpoint to move the method into

the `OpenXrController` class.



Also cleans up a couple unused methods and moves other methods that are

now purely internal to be private on `OpenXrController`.



Bug: 1504076

Change-Id: I6a26038d2ef02263c7302d697c84602322426476

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5097334

Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1235150}

entry.title: Intersect clip_rect with filter_bounds for PrepareRenderPassOverlay
entry.content:
After https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5046973

CalculateRPDQParams was not intersecting |filter_bounds| with the

SQS's |clip_rect| or the frame's |output_rect|, since they weren't

impacting renderpass backing or visibility checking, and SkCanvas was

already doing the same work internally.



However, in overlays, |filter_bounds| was used to determine the overlay

backing size directly so without this extra intersection, the overlay

dimensions increased and led to memory regressions. This restores the

intersection logic directly in the overlay prep code, since it's

already doing so much of the same logic to get the clip_rect and

filter_bounds in the same coordinate space.



I reworked the clip_rect mapping logic slightly to let it fall back

to the output_rect so that that is applied to filter_bounds before

allocating the overlay backing.



Bug: chromium:1507391

Change-Id: Ibb73fc6491497eb3d4ce3dcd1a4634382f0d3acc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5095673

Commit-Queue: Michael Ludwig

Reviewed-by: Kyle Charbonneau

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1235147}

entry.title: [IP Protection] Move is_for_ip_protection_ from ProxyInfo to ProxyChain
entry.content:
Move the is_for_ip_protection_ boolean from ProxyInfo to ProxyChain.

ProxyInfo stores a ProxyList of ProxyChains, but in the case where

IP Protection proxy chains were merged into an existing proxy config,

it's not correct to say that all proxy chains in the proxy info are

for IP Protection. This is important because it will allow us to

more precisely take action when IP Protection proxies are in use

(specifically, collecting metrics for and appending a custom header

to traffic that went through the IP Protection proxies).



We currently support adding a direct proxy chain for IP protection

solely for the purpose of collecting metrics about traffic that

would be proxied if IP Protection were enabled, so this

functionality is maintained. When that feature is disabled, though,

we won't tag the direct proxy chain that we add to ensure fallback

as being for IP protection, so that the metrics we collect will

only correspond to traffic that actually went through a proxy.



Bug: 1482271

Change-Id: Iee9800409a38954bd3dd56f49edeee475a58d22c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5085209

Reviewed-by: Dustin Mitchell

Reviewed-by: Dominic Farolino

Commit-Queue: Andrew Williams

Reviewed-by: Matt Menke

entry.title: Already focused element should not trigger updateStyleAndLayout
entry.content:
We are getting a crash with this (simplified) stack:

Document::UpdateStyleAndLayout()

Element::CanBeKeyboardFocusableScroller()

Element::SupportsFocus()

HTMLElement::SupportsFocus()

Node::ShouldHaveFocusAppearance()

LayoutTheme::ShouldDrawDefaultFocusRing()



ShouldHaveFocusAppearance() is only called when the node is focused

and shouldn't need an UpdateStyleAndLayout when checking SupportsFocus.



We avoid the update by adding new enum UpdateBehavior::kNoneForIsFocused

that will skip the update in Element::CanBeKeyboardFocusableScroller.



Change-Id: I052c36f58b558192ca07f7882b77b175df2945c2

Bug: 1509118

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5101833

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Pass the information about the credentials store
entry.content:
ChromePasswordManagerClient::NotifyUserCredentialsWereLeaked currenlty

starts the leak detection dialog with the account email if there is

a password syncing user in Chrome. The leak warning dialog uses the

account email to show the button that leads to the UPM password check.

If the account email string is empty, the password check for the local

store will show. Otherwise, the password check for the account store

will show.



This CL makes it possible to pass an empty account email string

and lead the password check button to the password check for the local

store in case the credential that was entered and caused the leak

warning was saved only in the local store (despite the password syncing

user being signed in).



because CredentialLeakControllerAndroid is not owned by the client.



Bug: b/306669939

entry.title: [dPWA] Integrate Link Capturing IPH with web_apps guardrails
entry.content:
This CL integrates the link capturing IPH bubble with the

guardrail system that the web_applications/ code uses to take into

account global (app agnostic guardrails). It does so by:

1. Ensuring that the guardrail system can account for only global

guardrails being defined (since per app is already handled by the IPH system).

2 Hooking up global IPH guardrails to chrome://web-app-internals.

3. Modifying the FeaturePromoParams being passed to the bubble so

that acceptances and cancellations are measured together at the

same place.

4. Adding some tests that verify the correct behavior on accepting or

dismissing the guardrails.

entry.title: ash: desk switching to handle failed screenshots gracefully
entry.content:
When switching desks, screenshots are made of the starting and target

desks. If taking a screenshot fails two times, then we will hit a

`NOTREACHED`. From there on, the failed desk switching can put ash in a

weird state.



This CL removes the `NOTREACHED` from `RootWindowDeskSwitchAnimator` and

changes `DeskAnimationBase` so that if any of its animators (one per

display) shows signs of distress, the whole project is abandoned. The

target desk is activated immediately without any animation.



TEST=Manual testing on device

BUG=b:313301644

entry.title: Disable blink parsing when in-browser parsing is enabled
entry.content:
Today, attribution requests' responses are parsed in blink. After the

migration: kAttributionReportingInBrowserMigration, the responses to

keepalive requests will be handled in the browser process directly.



To avoid responses from being handled twice (and therefore duplicating

the registrations), in this CL we stop processing responses in blink

when they are handled in the browser.



We also transfer the logic which indicates the number of background

registrations expected to be tied to a navigation from

`RegisterNavigationDataHost` to a new method

`NotifyNavigationWithBackgroundRegistrationsWillStart`. This allows us

to avoid binding a datahost that won't be used and will make it easier

to remove `RegisterNavigationDataHost` completely once the migration

will be done.



Bug: 1374121

Change-Id: Id06a1be525509c7c479f6cddaf188e6dbd7a86c3

entry.title: Cleaner fragment count change detection for paint invalidation.
entry.content:
Decouple fragment size and count change detection. Only detect size

changes during layout (and still only if we're fragmented). We can defer

detection of count changes to pre-paint. Doing that reliably in the

middle of layout is impossible, so there were false positives.



No behavior changes intended.



Add a test, to prove that the change in PaintPropertyTreeBuilder::

UpdateFragmentData() is needed.

entry.title: Add histogram to record SQLite errors in AggregationServiceStorageSql
entry.content:
When AggregationServiceStorageSql::DatabaseErrorCallback runs, it will

record the SQLite error in this new histogram, provided that the error

was considered non-fatal.



If this histogram reveals a low volume of "catastrophic" errors related

to disk corruption, we should feel comfortable trashing the database

when we encounter these errors. (See sql::IsErrorCatastrophic().)



Separately, we should investigate whether we can improve the quality of

database error checking in AggregationServiceStorageSql. In particular,

I believe that we should be checking `sql::Statement::is_valid()` before

calling `Run()` or `Step()`. Returning early from functions when the

statement is invalid may prevent knock-on errors from functions that run

two statements in sequence.



Bug: 1507968

Change-Id: Ia3c0adf85caaf666c4c5009166a50d5cdb311901

entry.title: Improved web native theme update for Aura, Mac and Win
entry.content:
This CL improves how NativeThemeAura, NativeThemeMac and NativeThemeWin

update their web instances. The web native theme is updated via the

ColorSchemeNativeThemeObserver, which notifies the web native theme of

changes to dark mode, high contrast, preferred color scheme and

preferred contrast.



This CL:

1.) Adds a NativeTheme* theme_to_update param in the ctor of the

NativeTheme class

2.) Replaces the existing conditionally heap allocated

color_scheme_observer_ member for each class with a by-value member in

the NativeTheme that observes the system color scheme changes.

3.) Uses of a ScopedObservation member instead of a direct AddObserver

call to manage the lifetime of the observer and avoid dangling pointers

when instances are destroyed.



This change does not introduce any functional changes.



Bug: 1231644

Change-Id: I146967e8fe7c3649b9245b16b386ef40dedcaa71

entry.content:

entry.title: [VCN Enroll] Log "sheet shown" metric in bottom sheet.
entry.content:
Before this patch, when kAutofillEnablePaymentsAndroidBottomSheet

feature was enabled, showing the VCN enroll bottom sheet did not log the

"sheet shown" metric, because the code path early-returned out of the

method, before hitting the metric logging at the bottom of this method.



This patch removes the early-return from the

kAutofillEnablePaymentsAndroidBottomSheet feature's code path and allows

the execution to continue to the bottom of the method, where the metrics

are being logged.



After this patch, the VCN enroll bottom sheet logs the "sheet shown"

metric.



Bug: 1494135

Change-Id: Ia537d5f44d1abf860a5e0b661d37409ff0779d8b

entry.title: [sync] Update DataTypeStatusTable before configuration
entry.content:
Currently, DataTypeStatusTable instance in DataTypeManagerImpl is

updated with the controllers' states during initialization, where

types in NOT_RUNNING state and STOPPING state are allowed but skipped.

This allows a time frame where a data type could fail but not be

recorded in the status table.



This CL fixes that by simply updating the status table with failed data

type errors from the controllers, before configuration.

entry.title: Enable AutoSizeLazyLoadedImages
entry.content:
This patch enables the AutoSizeLazyLoadedImages flag by default.



When enabled, lazy loaded images with `sizes=auto` will use the layout

width of the image to select the source url from the srcset. For this

use case the image's width and height should be provided.



Spec:

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#sizes-attributes

https://chromestatus.com/feature/5191555708616704



Intent to Ship:

entry.title: Prefetch: Allow use of HTTP cache for same-site prefetches
entry.content:
Adds functionality behind a feature flag that's enabled-by-default. In

addition to adding WPT and some browser test coverage, it also makes

most resources in external/wpt/speculation-rules/prefetch/resources

non-cacheable to prevent them from interfering with tests (in

particular we rely on request headers being injected by the wpt

server, which doesn't happen when a cached response is used).

entry.title: [accessibility] Label images in the user's active tab
entry.content:
All calls to AccessibilityLabelsService::EnableLabelsServiceOnce() are

by way of a user's interaction with some UX relating to a tab -- either

a confirmation bubble or a context menu, both associated with a specific

tab. Rather than hunting around for the active browser window and its

active WebContents within EnableLabelsServiceOnce, have the caller pass

in the WebContents with which the user is interacting.

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition] Add PhysicsModel and unittest
entry.content:
Add a physics model and unittests. The model is derived from the

the web mock https://tdresser.github.io/slidey-ux-experiments/



DD: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UI9jHET4W6rBPgSbre-q75fcK0wEeGPbclG0-krxZn0/edit#bookmark=id.lnbyryiufgtv



The model expose two major APIs for the embedder (an animation

manager):

1. OnGestureProgressed: called when the user swipes across the screen.

The animations during this stage is purely driven by the user

gesture.

2. OnAnimate: called after the user has lifted the finger from the

screen. The OS and CC stack will be driving the animations.



This class is designed to be a WebContents level entity because its

owner, the animation manager, will have to be directly owned by the

WebContentsViewAndroid. And we plan to let the animation manager

reside in this directory as well.

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition] Add getters and test helper to the screenshot
entry.content:
Also add two getters on the NavigationEntryScreenshot, and one helper

for testing.



GetSize() is used to compare the screenshot's dimension

to the physical screen - e.g., if the screenshot is captured

vertically but the user flips the phone horizontally, we might not use

the screenshot directly.



navigation_entry_id() is used when the user signals not to start the

animated transition, where we need to put the screenshot back to its

navigation entry (by design, as soon as the user start dragging, we

will take the screenshot out of the cache and use the screenshot to

compose our UIResourceLayer).



GetBitmapForTesting() just forwards the underlying SkBitmap for the

ease of testing.



Bug: 1413521

entry.title: [blink] Make RealMainThreadScheduler the default
entry.content:
V8TestingScope expects a real MainThreadScheduler when constructed

with a valid URL due to

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/loader/frame_loader.cc;l=393?q=frame_loader.cc:393&ss=chromium



Since many tests use this, this CL makes RealMainThreadScheduler()

the default and only option.

This should reduce friction while completing blink_unittests_v2 migration.

The downside is that we lose the annotation of which test actually

need a real scheduler.



RealMainThreadScheduler() is still exposed to avoid updating all

callsites in this CL. This will be cleaned-up in a follow-up.



Bug: 1315595

entry.title: [ios] Delay saving the unrealized WebState data to disk
entry.content:
Delay saving the unrealized WebState data to disk when calling

CreateUnrealizedWebState(...) until the session is saved. This

avoid creating many background tasks when multiples WebStates

are created quickly (e.g. BYOT or similar situation).

entry.title: Allow updating execution_mode to frozen-context.
entry.content:
Currently execution_mode was only updating if the updated value was

"compatibility" or "group-by-origin". This change allows for it to

also be updated to "frozen-context", and tests that it is done so

correctly.



This change is behind the "EnableUpdatingExecutionModeToFrozenContext"

flag and is disabled by default.



Along with these changes:



- We ensure that anytime execution_mode is trying to be updated to a

unrecognized mode, the mode will fallback to "compatibility".



-Created a new histogram (Ads.InterestGroup.AuctionExecutionMode)

to track the execution mode of InterestGroup updates.



Bug: 1504531

Change-Id: I38fe38901e5d4c1a46d031faa29ec40a540c5dbb

entry.title: [Signin] Fix TriggerListAccounts
entry.content:
Currently in `HandleNextRequest()`, if there is an in progress

/ListAccounts request, any new /ListAccounts request will not be

executed and will be removed from the queue of requests when the current

request completes.



Any cookie changes or calls to `TriggerListAccounts()` will not be

captured if it happens while there is in progress /ListAccounts request.



This CL changes the logic to the following:

- If the next request to be executed is /ListAccounts, remove all other

list accounts in the queue as they should have the same result. They

were triggered before this request starts.

- If the queue contains other requests (set accounts or logout), move

/ListAccounts request to the end of the queue as OAuthMultiLogin and

logout are likely to impact/require a new list accounts request.



Bug: b/314281485

Fixed: 1051864

Change-Id: I7275707e797f12187564e4b17fe857730cdf881c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5097208

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Commit-Queue: Monica Basta

Reviewed-by: David Roger

entry.title: Clamp the input value correctly before scheduling an AudioParam event
entry.content:
When the AudioParam value is set via the setter, it internally calls

the setValueAtTime() function to schedule the change. However, the

current code does not correctly clamp the value within the nominal

range. This CL fixes the problem.



Bug: 1505086

Test: Locally confirmed with both negative and positive param values.
